result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael M Strong was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $265.60 fine/cost to be paid to COCC within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay will be warrant.

Must provide DNA sample and pay the $200.00 DNA surcharge to the COCC within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay will be warrant.   Defendant may request expungement of the DNA sample under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4) by petitioning the Wisconsin Department of Justice. Expungement of DNA is NOT a court process. 
For information see: http://www.doj.state.wi.us/dles/crime-labs/clb-forms.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael M Strong

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael M Strong in court with attorney Dan Firkus.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  BJM-clerk 10:18 am  Def - NC plea.  CT accepts plea, finds Def G & enters JOC.  SENTENCE:  $265.60 fine/costs, $200 DNA surchg, 60 dtp or set up PP.  PCR.  10:26 am adj.

Not to possess or use drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion.  Not to commit any new crimes.  Must appear at all future court appearances.  Defendant shall give written notice to the Clerk of this Court within 48 hours of any changes of address or telephone number.

Defendant Michael M Strong in court with attorney Dan Firkus.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. KJB clerk. 254pm Def to call COC w/updated physical address ASAP. NG pleas. WST. bond cont. 2:55pm adj.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Report in support of probable cause for arrest. Request for criminal complaint
